The fall of the Roman Empire is a complex historical event that is attributed to a combination of internal and external factors. Some of the main reasons for the fall of Rome include political instability, economic troubles, social unrest, military defeats, and invasions by barbarian tribes. The empire also faced challenges such as overexpansion, corruption, and a weakening of traditional Roman values. These factors combined to weaken the empire over time until it eventually collapsed in 476 AD.
